00058 sub tex2pdf {
00059     my $self    =   shift;
00060     my $rh      =   shift;
00061     local($|)   =   1;
00062     my $out     =   {};
00063     unless ($rh->{pw} eq $PASSWORD ) {
00064         $out->{error}   =   404;
00065         return($out);
00066     }
00067     #obtain the path to the file
00068     my $filePath        =   $rh->{fileName};
00069     my @pathElements    =   split("/", $filePath);
00070     
00071     # grab the last element as the fileName
00072     #remove the extension from the file name
00073     my $fileName    =   pop @pathElements;    
00074     $fileName       =~  s/\.pg$//;
00075     
00076     #Create the full url and the full directory path -- If pathElements is empty this can give an extra //? Should I worry? maybe
00077     my $url              =  $TEMP_BASE_URL. join("/",@pathElements);
00078     $url                .=  '/' unless $url =~ m|/$|;   # only add / if it is needed.
00079     $url                .=  "$fileName.pdf";
00080     my $texFileBasePath  =  $TEMPDIRECTORY.join("/",@pathElements); 
00081     $texFileBasePath    .=  '/' unless $texFileBasePath =~ m|/$|;
00082     $texFileBasePath    .= "$fileName";
00083     
00084     # create the intermediate directories if they don't exists
00085     # create a dummy .pdf file
00086     surePathToTmpFile2($texFileBasePath.'.pdf');
00087 #   my $filePermission = '0775';
00088 #   chmod("$filePermission","$texFileBasePath.pdf") 
00089 #        or die "Can't change file permissions on $texFileBasePath.pdf to $filePermission";
00090     
00091     # Decode and cleanup the tex string
00092     my $texString = decode_base64(  $rh->{'texString'});
00093     #Make sure the line endings are correct
00094     $texString=~s/\r\n/\n/g;
00095     $texString=~s/\r/\n/g;
00096     
00097     # Make sure that TeX is run in batchmode so that the tex program doesn't hang on errors
00098     $texString = "\\batchmode\n".$texString;  # force errors to log.
00099     
00100     # Remove any old files
00101     unlink("$texFileBasePath.tex","$texFileBasePath.dvi","$texFileBasePath.log","$texFileBasePath.aux",
00102            "$texFileBasePath.ps","$texFileBasePath.pdf");
00103     # Create the texfile of the problem.
00104     local(*TEX);
00105     open(TEX,"> $texFileBasePath.tex") or die "Can't open $texFileBasePath.tex to store tex code";
00106     local($/)=undef;
00107     print TEX $texString;
00108     close(TEX); 
00109     
00110     
00111     # my $dviCommandLine = "$externalLatexPath $texFileBasePath.tex";# >/dev/null 2>/dev/null";
00112     # my $psCommandLine = "$externalDvipsPath -o $texFileBasePath.ps $texFileBasePath.dvi >/dev/null";# 2>/dev/null";
00113     # my $pdfCommandLine = "$externalGsPath -q -dNOPAUSE -dBATCH -sDEVICE=pdfwrite -sOutputFile=$texFileBasePath.pdf -c save pop -f $texFileBasePath.ps";
00114     # print "dviCommandLine:  $dviCommandLine\n";
00115     # print "psCommandLine:   $psCommandLine\n";
00116     # print "pdfCommandLine:  $pdfCommandLine\n";
00117     #print "execute pdflatex", `$externalpdflatexPath $texFileBasePath.tex`, "\n";
00118     #print "done $externalpdflatexPath   $texFileBasePath.tex\n";
00119     # Change to the working directory and create the pdf files.
00120     my $wd = $TEMPDIRECTORY.join("/",@pathElements); # working directory
00121     # print "---cd $wd &&  $externalpdflatexPath $fileName.tex\n";
00122     
00123     system "cd $wd &&  $externalpdflatexPath $fileName.tex >>$fileName.log";
00124     chmod 0777, "$texFileBasePath.pdf";
00125     unless ($debugOn) {
00126         unlink("$texFileBasePath.tex","$texFileBasePath.log","$texFileBasePath.aux",
00127            );
00128     }
00129     return({pdfURL => $url});
00130

00136 sub surePathToTmpFile2 {  # constructs intermediate directories if needed beginning at ${Global::htmlDirectory}tmp/
00137                # the input path must be either the full path, or the path relative to this tmp sub directory
00138          my $path      = shift;
00139          my $delim    = getDirDelim();
00140          my $tmpDirectory = $TEMPDIRECTORY;
00141     # if the path starts with $tmpDirectory (which is permitted but optional) remove this initial segment
00142     print "Original path $path\n";
00143         $path =~ s|^$tmpDirectory|| if $path =~ m|^$tmpDirectory|;
00144         $path = convertPath($path);
00145         print "Creating path to $path using $delim\n";
00146     # find the nodes on the given path
00147         my @nodes     = split("$delim",$path);
00148     # create new path
00149         $path   = convertPath("$tmpDirectory");
00150         print  "Creating path: $path\n ";
00151         while (@nodes>1 ) {
00152             
00153             $path = convertPath($path . shift (@nodes) ."/");
00154             print  "Creating path: $path\n ";
00155             unless (-e $path) {
00156             #   system("mkdir $path");
00157                 createDirectory($path,$tmp_directory_permission, $numericalGroupID) ||
00158                 die "Failed to create directory $path";
00159 
00160             }
00161 
00162         }
00163         $path = convertPath($path . shift(@nodes));
00164         print  "Creating path: $path\n ";
00165        # system(qq!echo "" > $path! );
00166 
00167 $path;
00168 
00169 }

00172 sub pretty_print_rh {
00173     my $rh = shift;
00174     my $out = "";
00175     my $type = ref($rh);
00176     if ( ref($rh) =~/HASH/ ) {
00177         foreach my $key (sort keys %{$rh})  {
00178             $out .= "  $key => " . pretty_print_rh( $rh->{$key} ) . "\n";
00179         }
00180     } elsif ( ref($rh) =~ /SCALAR/ ) {
00181         $out = "scalar reference ". ${$rh};
00182     } elsif ( ref($rh) =~/Base64/ ) {
00183         $out .= "base64 reference " .$$rh;
00184     } else {
00185         $out =  $rh;
00186     }
00187     if (defined($type) ) {
00188         $out .= "type = $type \n";
00189     }
00190     return $out;
00191 }
